issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description:
When I kicked off an SWF workflow (call it workflow B) from an initial SWF workflow (call it Workflow A), and within workflow B I checked to see if there were any outstanding open workflows and cancelled them.  In this case, workflow A was still open but just about to expire, and it did so during the request cancellation process.

I saw a giant stack trace in the log
{code}
2017-03-23 21:07:02 ERROR | com.eucalyptus.simpleworkflow.SwfMetadataException: Error updating workflow-execution 'b8ed1509-058d-4f63-9e8b-81444c7d6d4d' for arn:aws:euare::000852171185:
com.eucalyptus.simpleworkflow.SwfMetadataException: Error updating workflow-execution 'b8ed1509-058d-4f63-9e8b-81444c7d6d4d' for arn:aws:euare::000852171185:

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to find workflow-execution 'b8ed1509-058d-4f63-9e8b-81444c7d6d4d' for arn:aws:euare::000852171185:

{code}

Note that there is a com.eucalyptus.simpleworkflow.SwfMetadataNotFoundException in the cause chain, but it is not the "outer" exception.  If it were, the error returned would be 400 'UnknownResourceFault' response, but instead a 500 Internal Error response occurs.

This is difficult to catch as it requires specific timing on the workflow handling (I may see it 1 time in 10) and also the AWS SDK seems to retry by default, in which case we get a 400 UnknownResourceFault exception correctly immediately after the 500 Internal Error. 

You may be able to determine this behaviour by looking at the /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-requests.log in which case you would see something like this:

 
{code}
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 26f25001-7448-4ffc-b20f-5386fa7c3007 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:36640 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow WorkflowExecutionDetail [200 OK]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 2f75f204-bf39-4e0f-ae0c-483b6f5d4315 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:36640 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 90a53268-4d22-4a4a-a897-387035f7f42a arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:54074 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow DescribeWorkflowExecutionRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 962ade18-2215-4224-81bd-bcf1642cd684 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:58910 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow SimpleWorkflowMessage [200 OK]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 90a53268-4d22-4a4a-a897-387035f7f42a arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:54074 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow WorkflowExecutionDetail [200 OK]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 2f75f204-bf39-4e0f-ae0c-483b6f5d4315 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:36640 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow SimpleWorkflowErrorResponse [500 InternalError]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 81f5a6fc-8943-42d3-aad5-c7f25509995b arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:54074 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow RespondActivityTaskCompletedRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 c4fe2553-10aa-4036-82f5-616d29e59241 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:36640 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 f10dde6c-3589-4e5f-9a35-e114970cabf3 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:58910 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow PollForDecisionTaskRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 9b22415b-00b2-4240-b056-989ea633b71f arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:45934 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow PollForActivityTaskRequest [POST,--REDACTED--]
Fri Mar 24 11:08:20 2017 c4fe2553-10aa-4036-82f5-616d29e59241 arn:aws:euare::000816474836:user/admin /10.111.1.110:36640 /10.111.1.110:8773 simpleworkflow SimpleWorkflowErrorResponse [400 UnknownResourceFault]
{code}

Note the request ids for the RequestCancelWorkflowExecutionRequest (and the responses: InternalError then UnknownResourceFault in quick succession)
fields.summary: SimpleWorkflow: InternalError when canceling workflow execution

comments.body:
git branch dev-ethomas-EUCA-13323
git show 689ea9c4538505c56feb1d0d98f177bf01f1b57a


Made the appropriate cause of the error the actual error in SwfPersistenceSupport.java (per @sjones).
[~ethomas], looks good to me. Thanks for fixing.

[~mmunn1]
To get the timing right, you'd probably have to write some code.  Create two SWF workflows, have one kick off the other when it is done, and cancel the original immediately in the second one.  This could be done with the aws sdk, though it would be hard to pick up as you'd also have to disable retry on a 500 error.  I think the best way is to find a completed workflow and try to cancel it (maybe with the aws cli) and make sure you get an 'UnknownResourceFault'  instead of 'InternalError' response.  The timing was tricky before anyway.  Let me know if I can provide more info.  [~sjones], anything to add?
I would think general regression testing for cloudformation / elb would be sufficient to verify this issue.
